projects.title: MK Test Systems Automation Publication
projects.description:
SANTON SWITCH TO AUTOMATED TESTING TO SAVE TIME & IMPROVE QUALITY
Slow, manual testing has been switched for a
highly automated “all-in-one” method since
Santon Switchgear implemented the F2500
Automeg into their production process.
THE PROBLEM
Santon was using a variety of manual methods to test
switch connections at their Rotterdam facility, which
included writing all measurements by hand for just one
of the many test stages.
This was resulting in a slow production rate and an
inconsistent quality control process.
It was clear the processes could be improved in several
ways; “efficiency, speed, flexibility, and reliability” were
the key requirements for the project brief.

"We really value the flexibility of the system and the quality to the results; the F2500 delivers exactly what we were looking for"

"In Summary, the F2500 enables quicker all-in-one testing, with fast error recognition showing the exact switch connection that caused the failure." - Zander van der Steege

contributors.headline: Mechatronics Project Engineer at Santon Switchgear

projects.title: International NAO Project (Robot Tai Chi Teacher)
projects.description:
This is a Project that was done with a gruop of five students at HHS Mechatonica Delft. We each had our own part to play. The project was to program a NAO Robot with aldebaran software, some added python image proccessing and speech recognition with python. The NAO Robot when activated will be in an interaction status. Once the NAO recognises a user  with the facial recognition software it will ask "Are you ready to learn tai chi young one?". Furthermore it will give a choice in which one on the 5 lessons you would like to do. these lessons require the user to wear a special outfit with different colors on the different body part joints and a white backround. The NAO then could for example show you what to do and then afterwards use its camera to check if your doing the right movement.
My role was to program a big part of the Human interaction software. So i programmed which randomised things the NAO said while communicating with the users.

contributors.headline: Mechatronics Project Engineer at Santon Switchgear

projects.title: Scafholding lifting aid
projects.description:
In my 2nd project I was involved in as a first year at The University of Aplied Science was to create a scafholding builder. This team, "Steiger tilhulp groep 8",achieved the following:

A scafholding lifting aid with two main functions:
Assembly of scafholding
Disassembly of scafholding

The Assembly:
The scafholding lifting aid will start with the assembly by lifting up 1 level of a scafholding twice its height so that another level can be buildt under it and attached to it. Once it has been attached to it the hooks will slide down with the hindge mechanism. Then it will pick up the scafholding once agiain to twice its height. This procces wil carry on until desired height is reached.
 

The Disassembly:
The scafholding lifting aid will finish off by lifting up x level(s) of a scafholding twice its height so that the bottum level can be disassembled. Once it has been disassembled it will lower the level(s). Then it will release the hooks with help from two servo motors and move up so that it can pick up the scafholding once agiain to twice its height. This enables the bottum part to be disassembled. This procces wil carry on until the entire scafholding has been disassembled.

projects.title: The Gantry Crane
projects.description:
My 3rd project of the first year was to design build and program a gantry crane. I was in a group of six as i was in almost every project.

The main function(s) of the gantry crane:
We were tasked to make a gantry crane that had 3 axis's. The crane had to be able to pick up a metal container with a small powerful elektromagnet and move it to a different location. For example from a ship to the land or just to the given locationand remember the location in the memory even when turned off. Then it can empty and refill the cargo with no difficulty at all.

projects.title: lifting bridge
projects.description:
My first project assignment at The University of Aplied Science was to create a bridge with the given pre-model with a team. We called ourselves "De Ophaalbrug", translated as the drawbridge. 

The drawbridge has many functions - but mainly to open and to close. The other functions are safety precation related.

Safety precation functions:
 A wind speed turbine
Infra-red sensors that check when there's a boat under the Bridge
Gate barriers to prevent cars and pedestrians from going onto the bridge before it rises
Flashing lights to show that the 
A speaker to make a noise giving a signal that the barriers are coming down.
barriers are comeing down

profile_positions.description: The only mechatronics engineer in Santon Industry Department. Responsible for hands-on project engineering, electrical design and software solutions, ongoing client liaison, test engineering, creating technical manual documentation for the designs, cooperating with the mechanical engineer for manufacturing and also guiding technical interns for mechatronics solutions.
profile_positions.title: Project Engineer + Lead test Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Equinox MHE is a system integrator specialized in sorting machines for packaging companies (Bol.com, Decathlon, and other logistics companies).
The main assignment was to research the implications of a Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) system that monitors the operation of a Left-Right(LR) pilot sorter. I gathered intel, compared software, selected software and then I designed, configured and programmed the SCADA to implement it into the Left-Right Sorting machine of Equinox MHE. 
The SCADA results with an HMI Interface that visualizes the sorting machines and shows in real-time the status of the sorter on the screen. The SCADA will minimize downtime and help both customer support and the on-site operators to address the issue(s) accordingly.
profile_positions.title: Scada Engineer intern

profile_positions.title: Mechatronica Student

profile_positions.description:
Internship at Antea Group
I was tasked to design a prototype that is able to measure the thickness of a dam pile. this was an 11-week project that started off with researching current methods that are used and other methods that can work for the same function. During the project, I gave suggestions to a current project that Antea group was busy with. I improved my manner of communication with companies for researching different products for measuring the thickness of a steel dam pile.
profile_positions.title: Prototype Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Internship/Stage at Siemens
Assignment: Bring two worlds together with one document. A drive engineer and a PLC programmer
must be able to Program a PLC with TIA Portal and control a motor with a Technology object and the
drive(for the G120), The S110/S120 use STARTER a drive engineering software used to configure the
drive for the motor and its purpose. In the end, it is all controlled by the Technology Objects. Now
instead of having a PLC programmer program the Software and a drive engineer program the configuration of the motor. Either one of them can use the document to do the configuration and the
programming of the software.
